item.title: Evolution of bitter taste receptors in primates
Clementine Chen
item.description: Pronouns: she/her/hers Hometown: Jinhua, China Fun Fact: My favorite Disney characters are Alice and the Cheshire Cat. In the lab: joined us for the summer research program 2022 and stayed until graduating (Spring 2024). Update: starting a Masters program in Fall 2024 in Computational Biology and Quantitative Genetics @ Harvard T.H. Chan school of Public Health. Quantifying the evidence for adaptive evolution of the TAS2R38 bitter receptor gene in primates Broader project: Evolution of bitter taste receptors in primates and other mammals/

item.title: Heterogeneity of dN/dS Ratios at the Classical HLA Class I Genes over Divergence Time and Across the Allelic Phylogeny
Kiwi genome provides insights into evolution of a nocturnal lifestyle
